data.title: Circle of Love (1964)
data.meta_description: In a chain reaction of romantic adventures, various people play musical beds in a remake of Max Ophul's "La Ronde."
data.text:
holy fuck this was bad. first of all, the sets were stunning. each one was intricate, gilded, beautifully put together and the characters on the screen were paired with matching outfits that were so dreamlike they were jemcore.

then the plot started - no, the sex started. the sexualisation of women as children, the weird and clunky dialogue, the unorganised jumps from scene to scene.. with a star studded cast like this one, i have no idea how vadim got it all so wrong.

the film is 1 hour 50 mins, and felt like four hours by the end. i feel the same way about hotdog… the movie! such a waste of beautiful sets and costumes. once jane fonda was off screen, i completely lost track of the entire shit show.

Vadim is no Ophüls. In spite of a star studded cast which includes Jane Fonda, Anna Karina, Jean-Claude Brialy, Marie Dubois, Jean Sorel and Maurcie Ronet, this reworking of LA RONDE (like much of the director's other work), is sluggish, clunky and uninspired (with occasional production design flourishes). Vadim's focus was always on sex, and while the film pushes some boundaries of what was acceptable in that era, there's really very little else to recommend here, other than to observe how beautifully the actresses are presented (particularly Fonda). And from this gay man's eyes, it's too bad Vadim couldn't have allowed for some of the handsome men in his cast to be the recipients of his gaze as well.

How did Vadim take this incredibly horny play, and make it as boring and dry as possible? But with beautiful costumes, set design, and actors. I was really just here to see Jane Fonda.

Loved the orchestral swell during the Count and the Actress, because who really cares what a hot dude has to say? Drown him out!

This doesn’t touch the greatness of Ophüls’ film at all, and the end piece makes it all about feminine something or other by showing shots of all the lady characters which is not at all the point.

Film #185 in MY YEAR OF MUBI

***

Like a full length PSA about the easy transmission of STDs.

Dude sleeps with Lady. Lady sleeps with other Dude. Other Dude sleeps with Other Lady. And so forth and so on, until we "CIRCLE" back to the first person again. Sigh.

Stories along the way? Boring and negligible. It's like a LIFETIME MOVIE made in '60s France. Really not my bag.

The premise is interesting (not original, but interesting) and that's about it. Moving on....
